title: Play School
brief_description: Play School is an Australian Gold Logie award-winning educational television show for children. It is the longest-running children’s show in Australia, and the second longest-running children’s show in the world.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherheadâ€™s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

constellations_other.name: Taking it slow
constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

description:
Play School is an Australian Gold Logie award winning educational television show for children produced by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation and then Southern Star Entertainment in 2014. It is the longest-running children’s show in Australia, and the second longest running children’s show in the world.

In 2016, Play School celebrated 50 years on the air. An estimated 80% of pre-school children under six watch the programme at least once a week.

It is screened twice every weekday afternoon at 3:05 pm on ABC1 every day 9:30 am and weekday 4:30 pm on ABC2’s ABC4 Kids.
